changes_made.change: Changed `[ ]` to `[[ ]]` for numeric comparisons on line 48
changes_made.reason: Bash best practice: Use `[[ ]]` instead of `[ ]` for conditionals to avoid word splitting and globbing issues

changes_made.change: Replaced emoji warning symbol with text 'WARNING:'
changes_made.reason: Project guidelines: Avoid using emojis unless explicitly requested by user

summary: All four files were reviewed. Two minor improvements were made: (1) validators.sh now uses [[ ]] consistently for all conditionals, and (2) worktree-cleanup.md no longer uses emoji in code examples. The process-utils.sh file was already well-written with proper shebang, local variable declarations, quoted variables, [[ ]] conditionals, comprehensive documentation, and security audit logging. The worktree-setup.md file has emojis in output examples which are acceptable as they represent expected user-facing output rather than code.

.claude/lib/process-utils.sh.security: SF-SEC-001/002/003 implemented (command verification, audit logging, ownership verification)
.claude/lib/process-utils.sh.note: set -euo pipefail not added as this is a library file meant to be sourced, which would affect sourcing scripts
